forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. South wind 9 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 5pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 57, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. South wind 14 to 36 mph, with gusts as high as 54 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As darkness blankets Downtown San Francisco, the rain begins to murmur against the rooftops, a gentle but persistent reminder of the forecasted downpour. The clouds hang low, draping the skyline in a muted gray that nearly obscures the landmarks that define the city. A brisk wind stirs, echoing through the streets, whispering tales of the storm to come. Tonight's temperatures will hover in the low fifties, the chill driven deeper by the gusts reaching up to 28 mph, making the evening feel all the more somber. The air feels thick with moisture, and though there's only a slight chance of precipitation for now, it’s an omen of the deluge to descend on the morrow.

As Wednesday arrives, the rain will become a steady companion, morphing into a series of showers and possible thunderstorms. The temperature will gradually dip, creating a dreary ambiance reminiscent of Van Gogh’s stormy skies. The robust winds will whip through the streets, ensuring that the day won’t be for the faint of heart. Amidst this tempest, raincoats and sturdy umbrellas will be essential; a heavier sweater or fleece may offer solace against the wind’s bite. Interesting moments to embrace include cozying up in a local café, the rich aromas of freshly brewed coffee mingling with the pitter-patter of rain, or perhaps wandering the bustling aisles of a bookstore, lost in pages as the world outside transforms into a watercolor of gray. It’s an invitation to momentarily pause, to wind down and to savor the subtler joys that arise when nature shows its might; a reminder that even in unyielding weather, one can find warmth and comfort within.
